intro: Hieracium megalosvaneticum, commonly known as the Svaneti hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellowish with a central disk. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in its habitat.
